activities:
MUSA undertakes managed hosting, dedicated server hosting, qualified (FDA-compliant) hosting, data storage, computer disaster recovery services, remote management and support services including scientific application support, lab-related technology initiatives and compliance. In doing so, MUSA primarily acts as a data processor, but may also act as a data controller with regards to personal information collected from MUSA’s own clients or prospective clients. MUSA adheres to the Department of Commerce’s Safe Harbor Privacy Principles with regard to processing personal information from the EU and Switzerland.

When MUSA is a data processor: In the course of providing hosting and computer disaster recovery services for its clients, MUSA may process personal information data controlled by its clients that its clients have received from the EU or Switzerland; MUSA does not determine what types of data its clients store on MUSA’s servers and how that data is acquired, categorized, classified, accessed, exchanged or otherwise processed. MUSA’s clients have control over such data at all times, and MUSA’s clients are responsible for compliance with all applicable data protection principles for their own customers. MUSA processes that data at the direction of its clients and in accordance with the terms of its agreements with its clients.

When MUSA is a data controller: MUSA collects personal information from clients, prospective clients, vendors, prospective vendors and other individuals located in the EU and Switzerland who are, or may be, interested in a business relationship with MUSA via website visits, telephone calls, web chat, web forms, email, written correspondence, business cards and other means; MUSA uses this information to communicate with those individuals about MUSA’s services and support. Such personal information collected may include a first and last name, physical address, email address, telephone number, company name, title, occupation and other contact information.
